intro: Rollinia hispida, commonly known as the rough-leafed star-apple, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Caricaceae, which includes other fruit-bearing plants like the papaya. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit, which resembles a star-shaped apple, is edible and has a sweet, aromatic flavor. Rollinia hispida is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of nutritious fruit.
